H0.text: Earth rotating on its axis causes the pattern of day and night on Earth.

H1.text: Earth orbits around the sun, causing the pattern of day and night on Earth.

H2.text: The moon rotating on its axis causes the pattern of day and night on Earth.

H3.text: The moon orbits around Earth is the motion that causes the pattern of day and night on Earth.

A4.text: Earth rotates once in about 24 hours with respect to the Sun, but once every 23 hours, 56 minutes and 4 seconds with respect to other distant stars.

A5.text: This is due to the tidal effects the Moon has on Earth's rotation.
